iati-activity.title: Kosovo Small Arms Control Initiative
iati-activity.description: The project is designed to reduce armed violence in Kosovo within the overarching framework of democratic governance, project will supported the work of the newly-established Kosovo Small Arms and Light Weapons Control Commission

iati-activity.title: Kosovo Small Arms Control
iati-activity.description: SALW control exercised by Kosovo’s security institutions in line with international standards Key elements of Kosovo, including voluntary surrender when appropriate Capacity of PISG/GOK and media actors to implement SALW control

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Implementation of Kosovo SALW Control Action Plan points in accordance with milestones and timeline for 2008-09 Achievement of quantitative and qualitative personnel and institutional development benchmarks established via baseline study Increased public confidence in security providers Increased integration of gender perspective in decision-making versus established baseline

baseline.comment: No implementation of Kosovo SALW Control Action Plan points KOSSAC Phase 2 baseline study of capacity needs and deficits UNDP Kosovo Early Warning Report No. 19 KOSSAC Phase 2 baseline study of capacity needs and deficits

actual.comment: All imported weapons have been duly marked with the sign RKS including the year of import. Over 1300 weapons confiscated and full report provided to Kosovo Police. Over 100 Kosovo institution representatives have been trained in tracing, illicit trafficking and identification of weapons and ammunition. The three targeted municipalities have drafted safer community plans, which were approved by municipal assemblies and are fully implemented. Public Pulse survey in Kosovo (April 2014 and November 2014) shows an increase of feeling safer in the streets of 7.7 % ( April 2014: 59.6% versus November 2014: 67.3 %)

iati-activity.title: Support to UN Coordination
iati-activity.description: The objective of this project is organization and effective coordination of Year II implementation of the UNKT Common Development Plan 2011-2015 in close cooperation with Thematic Working Groups and consultations with the Government of Kosovo.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description:
Number of biannual “Public Pulse Briefs” prepared and published, number of surveys held and number of policies and decisions that are based on data analysis and research.
Number of Action Papers addressing important issues prepared, Number of Kosovo institutions involved in preparation of Action Papers and number of policies and decisions that are based on data analysis and research.
Number of Public Pulse Analysis addressing important issues prepared and published and number of policies and decisions that are based on data analysis and research.

baseline.comment: Governmental and public institutions do not utilize data and research for decision making-and policy development.

target.comment: Two (2) “Public Pulse Briefs” prepared and published with disaggregated gender data One (1) Action Papers addressing important issues prepared in cooperation with Kosovo institutions One (1) Public Pulse Analysis per year

actual.comment:
Two (2) “Public Pulse Briefs” prepared and published with disaggregated gender data One (1) Action Papers addressing important issues prepared in cooperation with Municipality of Prishtina on the topic of “Violence and security in public schools of the Municipality of Prishtina”. This research became a reference document for the development of the Platform of the Municipality of Prishtina on security in schools 2015-2018
One (1) Public Pulse Analysis document prepared in cooperation with the Municipality of Ferizaj, on the topic of 'Causes and consequences of patient dissatisfaction with healthcare services in Ferizaj/Uroševac Municipality'

target.comment: Two (2) “Public Pulse Briefs” prepared and published with disaggregated gender data One (1) Action Papers addressing important issues prepared in cooperation with Kosovo institutions One (1) Public Pulse Analysis per year

actual.comment: Two (2) “Public Pulse Briefs” finalized and published with disaggregated gender data One (1) Action Papers addressing important issues finalized in cooperation with Prime Minister's Office One (1) Public Pulse Analysis finalized

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Number of evidence-based trade and industrial policies developed by MTI staff; Number of businesses in ERS benefiting from capacity building and trainings on import substitution and export promotion;

baseline.comment: Limited capacities of MTI staff to develop evidence based related policies; Limited knowledge on import substitution and export promotion among businesses in ERS.

target.comment: At least 3 evidence based policies designed by MTI relevant staff; At least 100 businesses benefiting from training and capacity development on import substitution and export promotion.

actual.comment: Department of Industry designed the “Concept of Kosova Industrial Policy” and contributed to drafting the sector profiles, report on natural born clusters, three policy assessments for priority trade and human development topics and ex-post assessment of tax regime; 850 businesses (16% women) benefited through different trainings, networking events and direct coaching.

target.comment: At least 3 evidence based policies designed by MTI relevant staff; At least 100 businesses benefiting from training and capacity development on import substitution and export promotion.

iati-activity.title: Increase Farmers Capacities
iati-activity.description: The project aim the increase farmers capacities in Horticulture in North and South regions of Kosovo

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Number of small farmers benefiting from training on applying for MAFRD grant scheme and direct small investment support.

baseline.comment: Limited number of small farmers benefit from agriculture development grant schemes.

target.comment: At least 20 small farmers benefit from training and small investment support.

actual.comment: 20 farmers (15% women) supported with greenhouses, irrigation system, and agriculture inputs; 2 farmers benefited from incubators.

target.comment: At least 580 small farmers benefit from training and small investment support.

actual.comment: 71 farmers (38% women) received direct support, 719 farmers supported with trainings and direct coaching; 105 benefited from experience-sharing study visits; 71 new jobs created (38% women).

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: # of innovative social media prototype solutions developed by municipalities to tackle identified business problems. % of municipal office staff trained in social media techniques. # of innovative social media prototype solutions developed by youth CSOs to tackle identified business problems. % of youth CSOs trained in social media techniques. # of young women and men who participated in interactive web-sessions and number of blogs/tweets posted by youth.

baseline.comment: • Currently no use of social media for public outreach by any Kosovo municipality. • Baseline 0

target.comment: Two targeted municipalities have established prototype social media platform to tackle the identified business problems and test the feasibility of the proposed solution. Relevant municipality staff is familiar with social media prototypes to address identified business problems. 100 young women and men have actively contributed to each of the four established platforms 100 young women and men in each municipality have been trained and actively engage in social media. At least two A minimum of 50 young women and men attend each tweeting and blogging session

actual.comment: A platform with iOS and Android application has been developed for the municipality of Gjilan/Gnjilane . 30% of municipal staff has been exposed and trained in social media management. 1,000 active contributions have been submitted by citizens in each civil society platform. 50 young people have been trained and engaged in blogging and development of visual communication tools. Interactive web-sessions between municipal staff and citizens were conducted through "Pyet" campaign 2,000 young people have been reached through outreach activities

target.comment: One target municipality has established a prototype social media platform

actual.comment: One municipalitie successfuly developed three apps scheduled to be released early next year The communication platform for municipalitie of Gjilan is live and functional.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Indicator 1: # of jobs created for vulnerable and excluded groups in a gender responsive manner Indicator 2: # of expanded business initiatives, including women in business improving ethnic relations Indicator 3: # of joint initiatives between target municipalities

baseline.comment:
FKP 51.5% of respondents see unemployment as the main problem facing their municipality; Obilic 38.0% of respondents see unemployment as the main problem facing their municipality. FKP 73.0% think that municipal problems can be solved by local authorities; Obilic 66.5% think that municipal problems can be solved by local authorities; UNDP Mosaic 2012 Survey Poor sustainability of employment among vulnerable communities Lack of information on types of informal enterprises in targeted communities No assessment available on types of vulnerability No formal and effective systems of communication between the municipality and communities Participatory approach to decision making is poor
The level of advice provision to the poor on legal issues is insufficient in comparison to demand Participatory approach to decision making is poor
The level of advice provision to the poor on legal issues is insufficient in comparison to demand

target.comment: Target 1: 116 job created through various Territorial Employment Pact (TEP) interventions Target 2: 45 micro-enterprises upgraded with proper equipment and tools

actual.comment: Result 1: 93 job created through various TEP interventions Result 2: 43 micro-enterprises updated with proper equipment and tools

target.comment: Target 1: 45 job created through various TEP interventions Target 2: 9 micro-enterprises upgraded with proper equipment and tools

actual.comment: Result 1: 42 job created through various TEP interventions Result 2: 33 micro-enterprises updated with proper equipment and tools

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Number of municipal staff trained in economic and rural development activities

baseline.comment: Limited capacities of economic and rural development departments within the two targeted Municipalities

target.comment:
Target 1.1: 8 municipal staff trained in economic and rural development activities Target 1.2: 135 representatives (women and men) of local businesses, NGOs, associations and farmers trained in economic and rural development activities
Target 3.1: 183 jobs created/formalized through TEPs in the two municipalities Target 3.2: Women constitute 35% of TEP beneficiaries Target 3.3: 45 micro-enterprises upgraded through TEPs

actual.comment:
Result 1.1: 91 municipal staff (12 women and 79 men) trained in economic and rural development activities 42 (9 women and 33 men) municipal officials from Štrpce/Shtërpcë municipality participated in trainings; 49 (3 women and 46 men) municipal officials from Dragash/Dragaš municipality participated in trainings; (Sources: GC&DA LLC final report on the implementation of the training) Result 1.2: 372 representatives (46 women and 326 men) of local businesses, NGOs, associations and farmers trained in economic and rural development activities 86 representatives (7 women and 79 men) of local businesses, 107 representatives (25 women and 82 men) of NGOs, 179 representatives (14 women and 165 men) of farmers are trained in economic and rural development. In addition, 206 participants (17 women and 189 men) participated in combined sessions for all target groups (Sources: GC&DA LLC final report on the implementation of the training)
Result 3.1: 299 jobs created/formalized through TEPs Result 3.2: Women as 28 % of TEP beneficiaries as direct recipients Result 3.3: 129 of rural micro-enterprises created or upgraded through TEPs

iati-activity.title: Out 2 - Grants from LDF
iati-activity.description: Creation of new jobs and income generation opportunities through an improved market positioning and productivity of local micro and small enterprises, including individual farmers in Municipalities of Štrpce/Shtërpcë and Dragash//Dragaš.

transaction.disbursement-channel: Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Indicator 2.1: Number of functioning newly created and upgraded businesses

baseline.comment: 419 registered businesses in Shtërpcë/ Štrpce and 829 in Dragash/ Dragaš (Source: SME Agency)

target.comment: Target 2.1. Up to 13 existing and new businesses in Shtërpcë/ Štrpce and in Dragash/ Dragaš are benefiting from the first Grant scheme through LDF;

actual.comment: Result 2.1. Zero of newly created and upgraded businesses functioning through the LDF grants (The results after the review and approval by the donor, will be final and the LDF will be able to inform the winners and start preparing the contracts. The implementation of contracts will be done in spring since all of the works are related to agriculture and cannot be done earlier, due the fact that the farmers can only start with their agriculture activities in spring and not in winter time);

target.comment: Target 2.1: 20 of newly created and upgraded businesses functioning through the LDF grants

actual.comment: Out of 31, 9 of newly created and upgraded businesses functioning, are from the LDF First call grants of 2014/2015 in which, 1 of them is women-led; As such,the first LDF call (9 grants) produced: 37 jobs created, out of which, 31 are permanent self-employed jobs and 6 seasonal jobs; 27 are women and 10 are men; 19 are family members and 18 non-family members; 20 of these belong to non majority community. In the second LDF call, 22 grants are almost all implemented, (3 of them women-led; the second installments are almost finalized for all 22 granted projects for small holder farmers in the second round of grants. This depends also from the nature of the projects/grants and the implementation period, which for couple of grants is until spring 2016). The creation of jobs, to be reported at the end of Q4 and during Q1 in 2016.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: - Percentage of KJI candidates for initial programme graduates pas the final exam and appointed as a judges and prosecutors. - Percentage of candidates who pass the bar exam Bar Exam. - 3% decrease of the cases court backlog as result of harmonized of the Judicial practice.

baseline.comment: - Lack of programme for KJI January-June 2015. -Bar Exam procedures lack transparency.Bar Exam is not harmonized with European standards. -446.254 number of cases pending in Basic Courts, lack of judicial practices.

target.comment: - Candidates for Judges and prosecutors have better practical skills to conduct their future duties. - Draft the Training Program for period January –June 2015

actual.comment: - 50% of the candidates for judges and prosecutors completed the practical training and successfully passed the final exam - Training programme for January-June 2015 developed.

target.comment: - Kosovo Judicial Institute (KJI) draft a three year strategy. - Bar Exam procedures are fully transparent and accessible to all minority groups in Kosovo. -Appeal and Basic Courts have harmonized Legal Practice in place, increasing as a result court efficiency.

actual.comment: -The KJI’s Strategic Plan (2015-2018) drafted. -Judicial/ Bar Exam Manual published in Albanian and Serbian Languages and published on the web-site -Guidelines for harmonizing judicial practices (criminal and civil field) at the Basic Courts and Court of Appeal are finalized and published
